name: Knowledge of Business modelling at level 6
description: Knowledge of the production of abstract or distilled representations of real world, business or gaming situations in traditional or trans-media applications, to aid the communication and understanding of existing, conceptual or proposed scenarios. Predominantly focused around the representation of processes, roles, data, organisation and time. Models may be used to represent a subject at varying levels of detail and decomposition.

We want to spread opportunity by offering access to education, providing what you need, when you need it, in a place you can reach.

criteria.narrative: The holder has demonstrated that they can explain and discuss the knowledge relevant to the following SFIA description: Defines modelling standards and quality targets for an organisation. Has continuing responsibility for the maintenance of models for a designated function. Initiates organisation-wide modelling improvement activities and obtains customer buy-in to general changes. May represent own organisation as a modelling expert in industry initiatives.
